Description: Body fragment of probably Attic pottery closed vessel; the right lower corner of a panel with double-dot frieze vertically and blank area as far as preserved horizontally; single diagonal line preserved inside panel.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 59, no. 211 pl. 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2063)
